00058 /*****************************************************************************\
00059  * NOTICE OF CONVENTION                                                      *
00060  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- *
00061  * Mspec links to Pcode, Hcode, and Lcode modules.  In order to allow this   *
00062  * to take place without requiring front-end modules to link to liblcode.a,  *
00063  * Mspec code is divided into two classes as follows:                        *
00064  *  - mi_*.c must not depend on linkage to liblcode.a                        *
00065  *  - ml_*.c may depend on linkage to liblcode.a                             *
00066 \*****************************************************************************/

00078 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00079 #define M_X86_SIZE_VOID         0
00080 #define M_X86_SIZE_BIT          1
00081 #define M_X86_SIZE_CHAR         8
00082 #define M_X86_SIZE_SHORT        16
00083 #define M_X86_SIZE_INT          32
00084 #define M_X86_SIZE_LONG         32
00085 #define M_X86_SIZE_FLOAT        32
00086 #define M_X86_SIZE_DOUBLE       64
00087 #define M_X86_SIZE_POINTER      32
00088 #define M_X86_SIZE_UNION        -1
00089 #define M_X86_SIZE_STRUCT       -1
00090 #define M_X86_SIZE_BLOCK        -1
00091 #define M_X86_SIZE_MAX          64
00092 
00093 #define M_X86_ALIGN_VOID        -1
00094 #define M_X86_ALIGN_BIT         1
00095 #define M_X86_ALIGN_CHAR        8
00096 #define M_X86_ALIGN_SHORT       16
00097 #define M_X86_ALIGN_INT         32
00098 #define M_X86_ALIGN_LONG        32
00099 #define M_X86_ALIGN_FLOAT       32
00100 #define M_X86_ALIGN_DOUBLE      32
00101 #define M_X86_ALIGN_POINTER     32
00102 #define M_X86_ALIGN_UNION       -1      /* depends on the field */
00103 #define M_X86_ALIGN_STRUCT      -1
00104 #define M_X86_ALIGN_BLOCK       -1
00105 #define M_X86_ALIGN_MAX         64
00106

00108 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00109 #define M_X86_MAX_FNVAR_REG             0
00110 #define M_X86_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX          04
00111 #define MIN_PARAM_SIZE                  (16 * 0)
00112 
00113 /* incoming and outgoing parameters */
00114 #define M_X86_INT_BASE                  0
00115 #define M_X86_FLT_BASE                  4
00116 
00117 #define M_X86_RET_I32                   0       /* return in EAX */
00118 #define M_X86_RET_I64                   0       /* return in EAX and EDX */
00119 #define M_X86_RET_ST                    0       /* no special pointer */
00120 #define M_X86_RET_F                     1       /* return in EAX */
00121 #define M_X86_RET_F2                    1       /* return in EAX */
00122 #define M_X86_VAR_PTR                   "$LV"

00124 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00125 /*
00126  *      The following functions are for documentation only.
00127  *      The function overhead is too great for actual usage.
00128  */
00129 void
00130 M_x86_void (M_Type type)
00131 {
00132   type->type = M_TYPE_VOID;
00133   type->unsign = 1;
00134   type->align = M_X86_ALIGN_VOID;
00135   type->size = M_X86_SIZE_VOID;
00136   type->nbits = 0;
00137 }
00138 
00139 void
00140 M_x86_bit_long (M_Type type, int n)
00141 {
00142   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_LONG;
00143   type->unsign = 0;
00144   type->align = M_X86_ALIGN_BIT;
00145   type->size = n * M_X86_SIZE_BIT;
00146   type->nbits = n * M_X86_SIZE_BIT;
00147   M_assert ((n <= 32),
00148             "M_bit_long: do not allow bit field of more than 32 bits");
00149 }
00150 
00151 void
00152 M_x86_bit_int (M_Type type, int n)
00153 {
00154   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_INT;
00155   type->unsign = 0;
00156   type->align = M_X86_ALIGN_BIT;
00157   type->size = n * M_X86_SIZE_BIT;
00158   type->nbits = n * M_X86_SIZE_BIT;
00159   M_assert ((n <= 32),
00160             "M_bit_int: do not allow bit field of more than 32 bits");
00161 }
00162 
00163 void
00164 M_x86_bit_short (M_Type type, int n)
00165 {
00166   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT;
00167   type->unsign = 0;
00168   type->align = M_X86_ALIGN_BIT;
00169   type->size = n * M_X86_SIZE_BIT;
00170   type->nbits = n * M_X86_SIZE_BIT;
00171   M_assert ((n <= 16),
00172             "M_bit_long: do not allow bit field of more than 16 bits");
00173 }
00174 
00175 void
00176 M_x86_bit_char (M_Type type, int n)
00177 {
00178   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR;
00179   type->unsign = 0;
00180   type->align = M_X86_ALIGN_BIT;
00181   type->size = n * M_X86_SIZE_BIT;
00182   type->nbits = n * M_X86_SIZE_BIT;
00183   M_assert ((n <= 8),
00184             "M_bit_char: do not allow bit field of more than 8 bits");
00185 }

00188 M_x86_float (M_Type type, int unsign)
00189 {
00190   type->type = M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00191   type->unsign = unsign;
00192   type->align = M_X86_ALIGN_FLOAT;
00193   type->size = M_X86_SIZE_FLOAT;
00194   type->nbits = M_X86_SIZE_FLOAT;
00195 }

00202   type->align = M_X86_ALIGN_DOUBLE;
00203   type->size = M_X86_SIZE_DOUBLE;
00204   type->nbits = M_X86_SIZE_DOUBLE;
00205 }

00207 void
00208 M_x86_pointer (M_Type type)
00209 {
00210   type->type = M_TYPE_POINTER;
00211   type->unsign = 1;
00212   type->align = M_X86_ALIGN_POINTER;
00213   type->size = M_X86_SIZE_POINTER;
00214   type->nbits = M_X86_SIZE_POINTER;
00215 }

00217 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00218 int
00219 M_x86_eval_type (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00220 {
00221   switch (type->type)
00222     {
00223     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00224       M_void (ntype);
00225       return (-1);              /* can not be evaluated */
00226     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00227     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00228     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00229     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00230     case M_TYPE_INT:
00231     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00232     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00233     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00234       /* the starting address of array is used */
00235       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00236       return (M_TYPE_INT);
00237     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00238       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00239       return (M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00240     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00241       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00242       return (M_TYPE_DOUBLE);
00243     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00244     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00245       *ntype = *type;
00246       return type->type;
00247     default:
00248       return (-1);
00249     }
00250 }
00251 
00252 int
00253 M_x86_eval_type2 (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00254 {
00255   switch (type->type)
00256     {
00257     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00258       M_void (ntype);
00259       return (-1);              /* can not be evaluated */
00260     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00261     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00262       M_char (ntype, type->unsign);
00263       return (M_TYPE_CHAR);
00264     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00265       M_short (ntype, type->unsign);
00266       return (M_TYPE_SHORT);
00267     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00268     case M_TYPE_INT:
00269       /* the starting address of array is used */
00270       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00271       return (M_TYPE_INT);
00272     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00273     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00274       M_long (ntype, type->unsign);
00275       return (M_TYPE_LONG);
00276     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00277       M_pointer (ntype);
00278       return (M_TYPE_POINTER);
00279     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00280       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00281       return (M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00282     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00283       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00284       return (M_TYPE_DOUBLE);
00285     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00286     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00287       *ntype = *type;
00288       return type->type;
00289     default:
00290       return (-1);
00291     }
00292 }
00293 
00294 int
00295 M_x86_call_type (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00296 {
00297   switch (type->type)
00298     {
00299     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00300       M_void (ntype);
00301       return (-1);              /* can not be evaluated */
00302     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00303     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00304     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00305     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00306     case M_TYPE_INT:
00307     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00308     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00309     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00310       /* the starting address of array is used */
00311       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00312       return (M_TYPE_INT);
00313       /* BCC - don't promote float to double now - 8/5/96 */
00314     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00315       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00316       return M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00317     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00318       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00319       return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00320     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00321     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00322       *ntype = *type;
00323       return (type->type);
00324     default:
00325       return (-1);
00326     }
00327 }
00328 
00329 int
00330 M_x86_call_type2 (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00331 {
00332   switch (type->type)
00333     {
00334     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00335       M_void (ntype);
00336       return (-1);              /* can not be evaluated */
00337     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00338     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00339       M_char (ntype, type->unsign);
00340       return (M_TYPE_CHAR);
00341     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00342       M_short (ntype, type->unsign);
00343       return (M_TYPE_SHORT);
00344     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00345     case M_TYPE_INT:
00346       /* the starting address of array is used */
00347       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00348       return (M_TYPE_INT);
00349     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00350     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00351       M_long (ntype, type->unsign);
00352       return (M_TYPE_LONG);
00353     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00354       M_pointer (ntype);
00355       return (M_TYPE_POINTER);
00356       /* BCC - don't promote float to double now - 8/5/96 */
00357     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00358       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00359       return M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00360     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00361       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00362       return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00363     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00364     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00365       *ntype = *type;
00366       return (type->type);
00367     default:
00368       return (-1);
00369     }
00370 }

00372 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00373 void
00374 M_x86_array_layout (M_Type type, int *offset)
00375 {
00376   *offset = 0;                  /* assume first element is aligned */
00377 }
00378 
00379 int
00380 M_x86_array_align (M_Type type)
00381 {
00382   return type->align;
00383 }
00384 
00385 int
00386 M_x86_array_size (M_Type type, int dim)
00387 {
00388   int mod, size, align;
00389 
00390   size = type->size;
00391   align = type->align;
00392   mod = size % align;
00393   if (mod != 0)
00394     size += (align - mod);
00395 
00396   return (size * dim);
00397 }
00398 
00399 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00400 void
00401 M_x86_union_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, int *offset, int *bit_offset)
00402 {
00403   int i;
00404   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00405     {                           /* assume the union is aligned */
00406       offset[i] = 0;
00407       bit_offset[i] = 0;
00408     }
00409 }
00410 
00411 int
00412 M_x86_union_align (int n, _M_Type * type)
00413 {
00414   int i, max;
00415   max = 0;
00416   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00417     {
00418       int aln = type[i].align;
00419       if (aln > max)
00420         max = aln;
00421     }
00422   /*
00423    *  align to at least byte boundary.
00424    */
00425   if (max < M_X86_ALIGN_CHAR)
00426     max = M_X86_ALIGN_CHAR;
00427 
00428   return max;
00429 }
00430 
00431 int
00432 M_x86_union_size (int n, _M_Type * type)
00433 {
00434   int i, aln, max_size, max_align;
00435 
00436   max_size = 0;
00437   max_align = 0;
00438   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00439     {
00440       int size;
00441       size = type[i].size;
00442       if (size > max_size)
00443         max_size = size;
00444       aln = type[i].align;
00445       if (aln > max_align)
00446         max_align = aln;
00447     }
00448   /*
00449    *  align to at least byte boundary.
00450    */
00451   if (max_align < M_X86_ALIGN_CHAR)
00452     max_align = M_X86_ALIGN_CHAR;
00453 
00454   /* need to increment to the max. align for future array extension */
00455   i = max_size % max_align;
00456   if (i != 0)
00457     max_size += (max_align - i);
00458 
00459   return max_size;
00460 }
00461 
00462 
00463 /* 
00464  * M_x86_struct_layout
00465  *
00466  *    INPUTS:   n          - the number of elements in the structure
00467  *              type       - an array of _M_Type structures for each element
00468  *                           in the structure
00469  *
00470  *    OUTPUTS:  base       - an array in which to store the offset into the
00471  *                           struct which should be addressed to load the 
00472  *                           element. 
00473  *              bit_offset - an array in which to store the bit offset of the
00474  *                           element from the base
00475  */
00476 void
00477 M_x86_struct_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, int *base, int *bit_offset)
00478 {
00479   int i;                        /* index for arrays */
00480   int struct_off;               /* the current offset into the struct */
00481   int mod;                      /* */
00482   int size;                     /* the size of the current element */
00483   int align;                    /* the aligment requirement of the 
00484                                    current element */
00485   int word_off;                 /* the offset into the current word */
00486   int bf_unit_size = 0;         /* the unit size of the bitfield 
00487                                    (eg. char, short, long) */
00488   int bf_unit_off;              /* the offset into current bitfield 
00489                                    unit size */
00490 
00491 
00492   struct_off = 0;               /* assume initially aligned */
00493 
00494   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00495     {                           /* for each element in the struct */
00496       size = type[i].size;      /* size of element */
00497       align = type[i].align;    /* alignment requirements of element */
00498       M_assert ((size != 0) && (align != 0),
00499                 "M_struct_layout: void is not allowed in structure");
00500 
00501       /*
00502        *  need to treat bit fields specially:
00503        *      - keep them in a word when possible
00504        *      - increase the unit size if necessary
00505        */
00506       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR ||
00507           type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT || type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00508         {
00509           word_off = struct_off % M_X86_SIZE_INT;
00510 
00511           /* if element doesn't fit in word, 
00512              then its offset is beginning of the next word */
00513           if ((word_off + size) > M_X86_SIZE_INT)
00514             struct_off += (M_X86_SIZE_INT - word_off);
00515 
00516           /* if element doesn't fit in aligned unit size, then successively
00517              increase unit size until it does */
00518           if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00519             {
00520               bf_unit_size = M_X86_SIZE_CHAR;
00521               bf_unit_off = struct_off % bf_unit_size;
00522 #if 1
00523               /* use for standard bitfields - JEM */
00524               if ((bf_unit_off + size) > M_X86_SIZE_CHAR)
00525                 {
00526                   type[i].type = M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT;
00527                   bf_unit_size = M_X86_SIZE_SHORT;
00528                 }
00529 #endif
00530             }
00531           if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT)
00532             {
00533               bf_unit_size = M_X86_SIZE_SHORT;
00534               bf_unit_off = struct_off % bf_unit_size;
00535 #if 1
00536               /* use for standard bitfields - JEM */
00537               if ((bf_unit_off + size) > M_X86_SIZE_SHORT)
00538                 {
00539                   type[i].type = M_TYPE_BIT_LONG;
00540                   bf_unit_size = M_X86_SIZE_LONG;
00541                 }
00542 #endif
00543             }
00544           if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00545             {
00546               bf_unit_size = M_X86_SIZE_LONG;
00547               bf_unit_off = struct_off % bf_unit_size;
00548               if ((bf_unit_off + size) > M_X86_SIZE_LONG)
00549                 {
00550                   /* problem:  can't increase size any more */
00551                   I_punt("M_x86_struct_layout:  "
00552                          "bitfield element does not fit in one word");
00553                 }
00554             }
00555 
00556 
00557 
00558 #if 0
00559           /* use for faster (non-standard) bitfields? - JEM */
00560 
00561           /* adjust the element alignment to the unit size */
00562           /* x86 does not require this alignment, but it will eliminate
00563              the need for shift instructions */
00564           if (bf_unit_size > type[i].align)
00565             {
00566               type[i].align = bf_unit_size;
00567               align = bf_unit_size;
00568             }
00569 #endif
00570         }                       /* end special treatment of bitfields */
00571 
00572 
00573 
00574       /* adjust offset to required alignment */
00575       mod = struct_off % align;
00576       if (mod != 0)
00577         struct_off += (align - mod);
00578 
00579 
00580       /* calculate the base (the offset into the struct which should
00581          be addressed to load the element) */
00582       /* calculate the bit_offset (the bit offset from the base of the 
00583          element) */
00584       switch (type[i].type)
00585         {
00586         case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00587         case M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT:
00588         case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00589           base[i] = struct_off & (~(bf_unit_size - 1)); /*mask off low bits */
00590           bit_offset[i] = struct_off - base[i];
00591 #if 0
00592           fprintf (stderr,
00593                    "bitfields:  type = %d, base = %d, bit_offset = %d\n",
00594                    type[i].type, base[i], bit_offset[i]);
00595 #endif
00596           break;
00597         default:
00598           bit_offset[i] = 0;
00599           base[i] = struct_off;
00600 #if 0
00601           fprintf (stderr, "type = %d, base = %d, bit_offset = %d\n",
00602                    type[i].type, base[i], bit_offset[i]);
00603 #endif
00604         }
00605 
00606 
00607       /* adjust offset to allocate space for current element */
00608       struct_off += size;
00609     }                           /* end for loop */
00610 }
00611 
00612 
00613 int
00614 M_x86_struct_align (int n, _M_Type * type)
00615 {
00616   int i, max;
00617   max = 0;
00618   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00619     {
00620       int aln = type[i].align;
00621       if (aln > max)
00622         max = aln;
00623     }
00624   /*
00625    *  align to at least byte boundary.
00626    */
00627   if (max < M_X86_ALIGN_CHAR)
00628     max = M_X86_ALIGN_CHAR;
00629   return max;
00630 }
00631 
00632 
00633 int
00634 M_x86_struct_size (int n, _M_Type * type, int struct_align)
00635 {
00636   int i, struct_off;
00637   int mod, size, align, max_align, word_off;
00638 
00639 
00640   struct_off = 0;               /* assume initially aligned */
00641   max_align = struct_align;
00642 
00643   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00644     {                           /* loop through each struct element */
00645       size = type[i].size;
00646       align = type[i].align;
00647       M_assert ((size != 0) && (align != 0),
00648                 "M_struct_layout: void is not allowed in structure");
00649 
00650       /* keep track of max alignment */
00651       if (align > max_align)
00652         max_align = align;
00653 
00654       /*
00655        *  need to treat bit fields specially:
00656        *      - keep them in a word when possible
00657        */
00658       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR ||
00659           type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT || type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00660         {
00661           word_off = struct_off % M_X86_SIZE_INT;
00662 
00663           if ((word_off + size) > M_X86_SIZE_INT)
00664             {
00665               /* if element doesn't fit in word, 
00666                  then its offset is beginning of the next word */
00667               struct_off += (M_X86_SIZE_INT - word_off);
00668             }
00669 
00670         }
00671 
00672 
00673       /* adjust offset to required alignment */
00674       mod = struct_off % align;
00675       if (mod != 0)
00676         struct_off += (align - mod);
00677 
00678       struct_off += size;
00679     }
00680 
00681 
00682   /* account for alignment of entire struct */
00683   if (max_align < M_X86_ALIGN_CHAR)
00684     max_align = M_X86_ALIGN_CHAR;       /* align to at least byte boundary */
00685   mod = struct_off % max_align; /* enforce max. alignment */
00686   if (mod != 0)
00687     struct_off += (max_align - mod);
00688 
00689 
00690   return struct_off;
00691 }
00692 
00693 
00694 
00695 
00696 
00697 int
00698 M_x86_layout_fnvar (List param_list, char **base_macro, int *pcount,
00699                      int purpose)
00700 {
00701   M_Param param;
00702   M_Type type;
00703   long int *offset;
00704   int *mode;
00705   int *reg;
00706   int *paddr;
00707   int *su_sreg;
00708   int *su_ereg;
00709   int cnt, i, size;
00710 
00711   cnt = List_size (param_list);
00712 
00713   type = alloca (cnt * sizeof (_M_Type));
00714   offset = alloca (cnt * sizeof (long int));
00715   mode = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00716   reg = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00717   paddr= alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00718   su_sreg = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00719   su_ereg = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00720 
00721   List_start (param_list);
00722   i = 0;
00723   while ((param = (M_Param) List_next (param_list)))
00724     {
00725       type[i++] = param->mtype;
00726     }
00727 
00728   size = M_x86_fnvar_layout (cnt, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
00729                              base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg, pcount,
00730                              0, purpose);
00731 
00732   List_start (param_list);
00733   i = 0;
00734   while ((param = (M_Param) List_next (param_list)))
00735     {
00736       param->offset = offset[i];
00737       param->mode = mode[i];
00738       param->reg = reg[i];
00739       param->paddr = paddr[i];
00740       param->su_sreg = su_sreg[i];
00741       param->su_ereg = su_ereg[i];
00742       i++;
00743     }
00744 
00745     return size;
00746 }
00747 
00748 
00749 /*  this variable is used to determine the first time fnvar_layout is 
00750     called.  It is initialized to 0, then set to one the first time 
00751     through the function                                             */
00752 static int have_reversed = 0;
00753 
00754 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00755 int
00756 M_x86_fnvar_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, long int *offset, int *mode,
00757                     int *reg, int *paddr, char **macro,
00758                     int *su_sreg, int *su_ereg,
00759                     int *pcount, int is_st, int purpose)
00760                                         /* need to return structure */
00761 {
00762   int i, max_align, off = 0, rg;
00763   int size, align, mod, tp;
00764 
00765 
00766   switch (purpose)
00767     {
00768     case M_GET_FNVAR:
00769       *macro = "$IP";
00770       /* return address is being pointed to be stack pointer */
00771       /* thus, offset to first parameter is 4 from stack pointer */
00772       off = 4 * 8;
00773       break;
00774     case M_PUT_FNVAR:
00775       *macro = "$OP";
00776       /* return address is being pointed to be stack pointer */
00777       /* thus, offset to first parameter is 4 from stack pointer */
00778       off = 0 * 8;
00779       break;
00780     case M_DONT_CARE_FNVAR:
00781     default:
00782       M_assert (0, "M_fnvar_layout: unknown purpose");
00783     }
00784 
00785   max_align = M_X86_ALIGN_MAX;
00786   rg = 0;
00787 
00788 
00789 
00790   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00791     {
00792       tp = type[i].type;
00793       switch (tp)
00794         {
00795         case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00796         case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00797         case M_TYPE_INT:
00798         case M_TYPE_LONG:
00799         case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00800           if (rg < M_X86_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00801             {
00802               mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00803               reg[i] = (rg)++ + M_X86_INT_BASE;
00804             }
00805           else
00806             {
00807               mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00808               reg[i] = -1;
00809             }
00810           break;
00811 
00812         case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00813           if (rg < M_X86_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00814             {
00815               mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00816               reg[i] = (rg)++ + M_X86_FLT_BASE;
00817             }
00818           else
00819             {
00820               mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00821               reg[i] = -1;
00822             }
00823           break;
00824 
00825         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00826           if (rg < M_X86_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00827             {
00828               if (rg == 0 || rg == 2)
00829                 {
00830                   mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00831                   reg[i] = rg + 1 + M_X86_FLT_BASE;
00832                   rg += 2;
00833                 }
00834               else if (rg == 1)
00835                 {
00836                   mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00837                   reg[i] = 3 + M_X86_FLT_BASE;
00838                   rg += 3;
00839                 }
00840               else
00841                 {
00842                   mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00843                   reg[i] = -1;
00844                 }
00845             }
00846           else
00847             {
00848               mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00849               reg[i] = -1;
00850             }
00851           break;
00852 
00853         case M_TYPE_UNION:
00854         case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00855           size = type[i].size;
00856           mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00857           reg[i] = -1;
00858           break;
00859 
00860         default:
00861           M_assert (0, "M_fnvar_layout: argument is not promoted");
00862         }
00863 
00864       /* The X86 convention is for the FP to contain a pointer to the 
00865          previous stack frame.  Because the stack grows down, the first
00866          function variable is available at FP -4.  The SP is at the bottom
00867          of the stack, and is used for push/pop beyond the local variable
00868          area. */
00869 
00870       size = type[i].size;
00871       align = type[i].align;
00872 
00873       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_UNION || type[i].type == M_TYPE_STRUCT)
00874         {
00875           /* make sure correct size and alignment is used for struct/union */
00876           /* passed indirectly thru registers                              */
00877           /* if IMPACT allowed structures to be passed via registers, this */
00878           /* would not have to be done                                     */
00879           if (mode[i] == M_INDIRECT_THRU_REGISTER)
00880             {
00881               size = M_X86_SIZE_INT;
00882               align = M_X86_ALIGN_INT;
00883             }
00884         }
00885       if (align >= M_X86_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX && type[i].type != M_TYPE_DOUBLE)
00886         /* anything larger than a 64-bit structure is passed */
00887         /* indirectly thru memory                            */
00888         align = M_X86_ALIGN_INT;
00889       else if (align < M_X86_ALIGN_INT)
00890         /* anything smaller that 32-bits is passed as 32-bits */
00891         align = M_X86_ALIGN_INT;
00892 
00893       mod = off % align;
00894 
00895       /* place the offset pointer to the boundary of the appropriate */
00896       /* data size                                                   */
00897       if (mod != 0)
00898         off += (align - mod);
00899 
00900       /* now increment the offset to point to the actual location    */
00901       /* for this parameter.  */
00902 
00903 
00904       offset[i] = off;          /* offset is positive for X86 */
00905       /* note offset for first parameter is set */
00906       /* before adding its size                */
00907       off += size;
00908     }
00909 
00910   /* The param section must be at least certain size.
00911    * This is the backing store for the parameter regs. */
00912   if (off < MIN_PARAM_SIZE)
00913     off = MIN_PARAM_SIZE;
00914 
00915   /* now for the body of the structures... small ones first. */
00916   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00917     {
00918       tp = type[i].type;
00919 
00920       size = type[i].size;
00921 
00922       if (((tp == M_TYPE_UNION) ||
00923            (tp == M_TYPE_STRUCT)) && (size <= M_X86_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX))
00924         {
00925 
00926           align = M_X86_ALIGN_MAX;      /* must align to a double boundry */
00927 
00928           mod = off % align;
00929 /*
00930             if ( mod!=0 )
00931                 off += (align - mod);
00932 
00933             off += size;
00934 */
00935           paddr[i] = -off;
00936         }
00937     }
00938 
00939   /* now large ones */
00940   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00941     {
00942       tp = type[i].type;
00943 
00944       size = type[i].size;
00945 
00946       if (((tp == M_TYPE_UNION) ||
00947            (tp == M_TYPE_STRUCT)) && (size > M_X86_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX))
00948         {
00949 
00950           align = M_X86_ALIGN_MAX;      /* must align to a double boundry */
00951 
00952           mod = off % align;
00953 /*
00954             if ( mod!=0 ) 
00955                 off += (align - mod);
00956 
00957             off += size;
00958 */
00959 
00960           paddr[i] = -off;
00961         }
00962     }
00963 
00964 
00965   /*  Because the X86 reverses operands, pushing them right to left,
00966      we need to reverse the order of operands on the stack         */
00967   have_reversed = 0;
00968 /*
00969     if (! have_reversed)  {
00970 
00971         for (i=0;i<n;i++)  {
00972             rev_mode[i] = mode[i];
00973             rev_reg[i] = reg [i];
00974             rev_offset[i] = offset[i];
00975             rev_paddr[i] = paddr[i];
00976             rev_type[i] = type[i];   
00977         }
00978 
00979         for (i=0;i<n;i++)  {
00980             mode[n-1-i] = rev_mode[i];
00981             reg[n-1-i] = rev_reg [i];
00982             offset[n-1-i] = rev_offset[i];
00983             paddr[n-1-i] = rev_paddr[i];
00984             type[n-1-i] = rev_type[i];   
00985         }
00986 
00987         have_reversed = 1;
00988     }
00989 */
00990   return off;                   /* the total size needed */
00991 }
00992 
00993 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00994 int
00995 M_x86_lvar_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, long int *offset, char **base_macro)
00996 {
00997   int i, max_align, off;
00998   int size, align, mod, tp;
00999   /*
01000    *  the LOCAL section must be max. aligned initially
01001    */
01002   max_align = M_X86_ALIGN_MAX;
01003   off = 0;
01004   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
01005     {
01006       tp = type[i].type;
01007       if (tp == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
01008         {
01009           M_assert (0, "M_lvar_layout: bit field not allowed");
01010         }
01011       if (tp == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
01012         {
01013           M_assert (0, "M_lvar_layout: bit field not allowed");
01014         }
01015       size = type[i].size;
01016       align = type[i].align;
01017       mod = off % align;
01018       if (mod != 0)
01019         off += (align - mod);
01020       off += size;
01021       offset[i] = -off;
01022     }
01023 
01024   /* the local section must be max. aligned */
01025   mod = off % max_align;
01026   if (mod != 0)
01027     off += (max_align - mod);
01028   /*
01029    *  Local variables are relative to $LV
01030    */
01031   *base_macro = M_X86_VAR_PTR;
01032   return off;                   /* the total size needed */
01033 }
01034 
01035 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01036 int
01037 M_x86_no_short_int (void)
01038 {
01039   return (M_X86_SIZE_SHORT == M_X86_SIZE_INT);
01040 }
01041 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01042 void
01043 M_x86_cb_label_name (char *fn, int cb, char *line, int len)
01044 {
01045   sprintf (line, "cb%d%s", cb, fn);
01046 }
01047 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01048 int
01049 M_x86_is_cb_label (char *label, char *fn, int *cb)
01050 {
01051   return (sscanf (label, "cb%d%s", cb, fn) == 2);
01052 }
01053 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01054 void
01055 M_x86_jumptbl_label_name (char *fn, int tbl_id, char *line, int len)
01056 {
01057   sprintf (line, "%s%s%d", fn, M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME, tbl_id);
01058 }
01059 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01060 /* Format for x86 is: %sM_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME%d, where %s is the func name    */
01061 int
01062 M_x86_is_jumptbl_label (char *label, char *fn, int *tbl_id)
01063 {
01064   char *ptr;
01065   int label_len, fn_len, base_len;
01066 
01067   /* Some length checks, to make sure we dont step outside array */
01068   label_len = strlen (label);
01069   fn_len = strlen (fn);
01070   base_len = strlen (M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME);
01071   if (label_len <= (fn_len + base_len))
01072     return (0);
01073 
01074   /* Check that fn is correct */
01075   ptr = label;
01076   if (strncmp (ptr, fn, fn_len))
01077     return (0);
01078 
01079   /* Check that jumptbl base name is correct */
01080   ptr += fn_len;
01081   if (strncmp (ptr, M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME, base_len))
01082     return (0);
01083 
01084   /* Get the id */
01085   ptr += base_len;
01086   return (sscanf (ptr, "%d", tbl_id) == 1);
01087 }
01088 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01089 int
01090 M_x86_structure_pointer (int purpose)
01091 {
01092   return M_X86_RET_ST;
01093 }
01094 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01095 int
01096 M_x86_return_register (int type, int purpose)
01097 {
01098   switch (type)
01099     {
01100     case M_TYPE_INT:
01101       return M_X86_RET_I32;
01102     case M_TYPE_LONG:
01103       return M_X86_RET_I32;
01104     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
01105       return M_X86_RET_F;
01106     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
01107       return M_X86_RET_F;
01108     default:
01109       return M_X86_RET_I32;
01110     }
01111 }
01112 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01113 /*
01114 char *M_x86_fn_label_name(label)
01115 */
01116 char *
01117 M_x86_fn_label_name (char *label, int (*is_func) (char *is_func_label))
01118 {
01119   static char fn_label[1024];
01120 
01121   if ((*is_func) (label))
01122     {
01123       sprintf (fn_label, "$fn_%s", label);
01124       return (fn_label);
01125     }
01126   else
01127     return (label);
01128 }
01129 
01130 
01131 char *
01132 M_x86_fn_name_from_label (char *label)
01133 {
01134   if (!strncmp (label, "_$fn", 4))
01135     return (label + 4);
01136   else
01137     return (label);
01138 }

01141 
01142 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01143 int
01144 M_x86_fragile_macro (int macro_value)
01145 {
01146   switch (M_model)
01147     {
01148     case M_386:
01149     case M_486:
01150     case M_KRYPTON:
01151     case M_PENTIUM:
01152       switch (macro_value)
01153         {
01154         case L_MAC_P12:
01155         case L_MAC_SP:
01156         case L_MAC_FP:
01157         case L_MAC_LV:          /* added SAM 10-94 */
01158         case L_MAC_IP:          /* added SAM 10-94 */
01159         case L_MAC_OP:          /* added SAM 10-94 */
01160         case L_MAC_LOCAL_SIZE:
01161         case L_MAC_PARAM_SIZE:
01162         case L_MAC_SWAP_SIZE:
01163           return 0;
01164         default:
01165           return (1);
01166         }
01167     default:
01168       M_assert (0, "M_x86_fragile_macro:  Illegal model specified!");
01169       return (0);
01170     }
01171 }
01172 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01173 int
01174 M_x86_subroutine_call (int opc)
01175 {
01176   switch (M_model)
01177     {
01178     case M_386:
01179     case M_486:
01180     case M_KRYPTON:
01181     case M_PENTIUM:
01182       return ((opc == Lop_JSR) || (opc == Lop_JSR_FS));
01183     default:
01184       M_assert (0, "M_x86_subroutine_call:  Illegal model specified!");
01185       return (0);
01186     }
01187 }
01188 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01189 /*
01190  * Declare code generator specific macro registers to the front end parser.
01191  */
01192 void
01193 M_define_macros_x86 (STRING_Symbol_Table * sym_tbl)
01194 {
01195   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "fr0", LX86_MAC_FZERO);
01196   /* 1 if leaf function, 0 if non-leaf */
01197   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$leaf", LX86_MAC_LEAF);
01198   /* total alloc requirements */
01199   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$alloc_size", LX86_MAC_ALLOC);
01200   /* number of integer and float callee saved registers used */
01201   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$callee_i_regs", LX86_MAC_CALLEE_I);
01202   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$callee_f_regs", LX86_MAC_CALLEE_F);
01203   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$stack", LX86_MAC_STACK);
01204   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$fpstack", LX86_MAC_FPSTACK);
01205   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$flags", LX86_MAC_FLAGS);
01206   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$eax", LX86_MAC_EAX);
01207   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$ebx", LX86_MAC_EBX);
01208   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$ecx", LX86_MAC_ECX);
01209   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$edx", LX86_MAC_EDX);
01210   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$esi", LX86_MAC_ESI);
01211   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$edi", LX86_MAC_EDI);
01212   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$ebp", LX86_MAC_EBP);
01213   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$esp", LX86_MAC_ESP);
01214   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$st0", LX86_MAC_ST0);
01215   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$st1", LX86_MAC_ST1);
01216   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$st2", LX86_MAC_ST2);
01217   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$st3", LX86_MAC_ST3);
01218   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$st4", LX86_MAC_ST4);
01219   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$st5", LX86_MAC_ST5);
01220   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$st6", LX86_MAC_ST6);
01221   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$st7", LX86_MAC_ST7);
01222 }
01223 
01224 char *
01225 M_get_macro_name_x86 (int id)
01226 {
01227   switch (id)
01228     {
01229     case LX86_MAC_LEAF:
01230       return "$leaf";
01231     case LX86_MAC_ALLOC:
01232       return "$alloc_size";
01233     case LX86_MAC_CALLEE_I:
01234       return "$callee_i_regs";
01235     case LX86_MAC_CALLEE_F:
01236       return "$callee_f_regs";
01237     case LX86_MAC_EAX:
01238       return "$eax";
01239     case LX86_MAC_EBX:
01240       return "$ebx";
01241     case LX86_MAC_ECX:
01242       return "$ecx";
01243     case LX86_MAC_EDX:
01244       return "$edx";
01245     case LX86_MAC_ESI:
01246       return "$esi";
01247     case LX86_MAC_EDI:
01248       return "$edi";
01249     case LX86_MAC_EBP:
01250       return "$ebp";
01251     case LX86_MAC_ESP:
01252       return "$esp";
01253     case LX86_MAC_STACK:
01254       return "$stack";
01255     case LX86_MAC_FLAGS:
01256       return "$flags";
01257     case LX86_MAC_FPSTACK:
01258       return "$fpstack";
01259     case LX86_MAC_ST0:
01260       return "$st0";
01261     case LX86_MAC_ST1:
01262       return "$st1";
01263     case LX86_MAC_ST2:
01264       return "$st2";
01265     case LX86_MAC_ST3:
01266       return "$st3";
01267     case LX86_MAC_ST4:
01268       return "$st4";
01269     case LX86_MAC_ST5:
01270       return "$st5";
01271     case LX86_MAC_ST6:
01272       return "$st6";
01273     case LX86_MAC_ST7:
01274       return "$st7";
01275 
01276     default:
01277       return "?";
01278     }
01279 }
01280 
01281 /* Added to support Lmix tools -JCG 11/21/95 */
01282 void
01283 M_define_opcode_name_x86 (STRING_Symbol_Table * sym_tbl)
01284 {
01285   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_FPUSH_I, LX86op_FPUSH_I);
01286   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_FPOP_I, LX86op_FPOP_I);
01287   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_PUSH, LX86op_PUSH);
01288   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_POP, LX86op_POP);
01289   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_NEGATE, LX86op_NEGATE);
01290   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_FXCH, LX86op_FXCH);
01291   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_SUB_F, LX86op_SUB_F);
01292   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_SUB_F2, LX86op_SUB_F2);
01293   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_SUBR_F, LX86op_SUBR_F);
01294   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_SUBR_F2, LX86op_SUBR_F2);
01295   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_DIV_F, LX86op_DIV_F);
01296   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_DIV_F2, LX86op_DIV_F2);
01297   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_DIVR_F, LX86op_DIVR_F);

01299   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_FSTCW, LX86op_FSTCW);
01300   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_FLDCW, LX86op_FLDCW);
01301   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_LEA, LX86op_LEA);
01302   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_TEST, LX86op_TEST);
01303   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_INC, LX86op_INC);
01304   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_DEC, LX86op_DEC);

01319   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_SUB_FMEM, LX86op_SUB_FMEM);
01320   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_SUB_F2MEM, LX86op_SUB_F2MEM);
01321   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_SUBR_FMEM, LX86op_SUBR_FMEM);

01335   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_CISC_TO_MEM_NEGATE,
01336                 LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM_NEGATE);
01337   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_CISC_TO_REG_CMP, LX86op_CISC_TO_REG_CMP);

01354   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, X86opcode_FP2INT_BRANCH, LX86op_FP2INT_BRANCH);
01355 }

01503 
01504 
01505 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01506 /*
01507  * Return true (1) if the instruction is supported in the hardware of the
01508  * processor.  Return false (0) otherwise.
01509  */
01510 int
01511 M_oper_supported_in_arch_x86 (int opc)
01512 {
01513   switch (opc)
01514     {
01515 
01516     case Lop_NOR:
01517     case Lop_NAND:
01518     case Lop_NXOR:
01519     case Lop_OR_NOT:
01520     case Lop_AND_NOT:
01521 
01522     case Lop_MUL_ADD:
01523     case Lop_MUL_ADD_U:
01524     case Lop_MUL_ADD_F:
01525     case Lop_MUL_ADD_F2:
01526     case Lop_MUL_SUB:
01527     case Lop_MUL_SUB_U:
01528     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV:
01529     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_U:
01530     case Lop_MUL_SUB_F:
01531     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_F:
01532     case Lop_MUL_SUB_F2:
01533     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_F2:
01534       return (0);
01535 
01536     default:
01537       return (1);
01538     }
01539 }
01540 
01541 /*
01542  * Returns the number of machine instructions required to implement the
01543  * specified oper in the best case.  It is assumed that this is for
01544  * supported instructions.  A call to M_oper_supported_in_arch should be
01545  * made for abnormal instructions.
01546  */
01547 int
01548 M_num_oper_required_for_x86 (L_Oper * oper, char *name)
01549 {
01550 
01551 #define has_label_operand(a)    ((a->src[0]->type == L_OPERAND_LABEL)||\
01552                                  (a->src[1]->type == L_OPERAND_LABEL))
01553 #define indexed_memory_op(a)    ((a->src[0]->type == L_OPERAND_REGISTER)&&\
01554                                  (a->src[1]->type == L_OPERAND_REGISTER))
01555 
01556 #define non_zero_offset(a)      (!((a->src[1]->type==L_OPERAND_IMMED)&&\
01557                                   ((a->src[1]->ctype&0x30)==0x00)) ||\
01558                                  (a->src[1]->value.i != 0))
01559 
01560 #define short_int_inc(a,b)      (((a->src[1]->type==L_OPERAND_IMMED)&&\
01561                                   ((a->src[1]->ctype&0x30)==0x00)) &&\
01562                                  (a->src[b]->value.i >= -0x10) &&\
01563                                  (a->src[b]->value.i < 0x10))
01564 #define long_pos_int_inc(a,b)   (((a->src[1]->type==L_OPERAND_IMMED)&&\
01565                                   ((a->src[1]->ctype&0x30)==0x00)) &&\
01566                                  (a->src[b]->value.i > 0) && \
01567                                  (a->src[b]->value.i < 0x2000))
01568 #define long_neg_int_inc(a,b)   (((a->src[1]->type==L_OPERAND_IMMED)&&\
01569                                   ((a->src[1]->ctype&0x30)==0x00)) &&\
01570                                  (a->src[b]->value.i >= -0x2000) && \
01571                                  (a->src[b]->value.i < 0))
01572 #define register_inc(a,b)        (a->src[b]->type == L_OPERAND_REGISTER)
01573 
01574   switch (oper->opc)
01575     {
01576     case Lop_ST_C:
01577     case Lop_ST_C2:
01578     case Lop_ST_I:
01579     case Lop_LD_UC:
01580     case Lop_LD_C:
01581     case Lop_LD_UC2:
01582     case Lop_LD_C2:
01583     case Lop_LD_I:
01584 
01585     case Lop_ST_F:
01586     case Lop_ST_F2:
01587 
01588     case Lop_LD_F:
01589     case Lop_LD_F2:
01590       return (1);
01591 
01592     case Lop_LD_PRE_UC:
01593     case Lop_LD_PRE_C:
01594     case Lop_LD_PRE_UC2:
01595     case Lop_LD_PRE_C2:
01596     case Lop_LD_PRE_I:
01597       if (indexed_memory_op (oper) || non_zero_offset (oper))
01598         return (2);
01599       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 2) || long_neg_int_inc (oper, 2))
01600         return (1);
01601       else
01602         return (2);
01603 
01604     case Lop_ST_PRE_C:
01605     case Lop_ST_PRE_C2:
01606     case Lop_ST_PRE_I:
01607       if (indexed_memory_op (oper) || non_zero_offset (oper))
01608         return (2);
01609       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 3) || long_neg_int_inc (oper, 3))
01610         return (1);
01611       else
01612         return (2);
01613 
01614     case Lop_LD_POST_UC:
01615     case Lop_LD_POST_C:
01616     case Lop_LD_POST_UC2:
01617     case Lop_LD_POST_C2:
01618     case Lop_LD_POST_I:
01619       if (non_zero_offset (oper))
01620         return (2);
01621       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 2) ||
01622                long_pos_int_inc (oper, 2) || register_inc (oper, 2))
01623         return (1);
01624       else
01625         return (2);
01626 
01627     case Lop_ST_POST_C:
01628     case Lop_ST_POST_C2:
01629     case Lop_ST_POST_I:
01630       if (indexed_memory_op (oper) || non_zero_offset (oper))
01631         return (2);
01632       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 3) || long_pos_int_inc (oper, 3))
01633         return (1);
01634       else
01635         return (2);
01636 
01637     case Lop_LD_PRE_F:
01638     case Lop_LD_PRE_F2:
01639       if (indexed_memory_op (oper) || non_zero_offset (oper))
01640         return (2);
01641       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 2))
01642         return (1);
01643       else
01644         return (2);
01645 
01646     case Lop_ST_PRE_F:
01647     case Lop_ST_PRE_F2:
01648       if (indexed_memory_op (oper) || non_zero_offset (oper))
01649         return (2);
01650       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 3))
01651         return (1);
01652       else
01653         return (2);
01654 
01655     case Lop_LD_POST_F:
01656     case Lop_LD_POST_F2:
01657       if (non_zero_offset (oper))
01658         return (2);
01659       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 2) || register_inc (oper, 2))
01660         return (1);
01661       else
01662         return (2);
01663     case Lop_ST_POST_F:
01664     case Lop_ST_POST_F2:
01665       if (non_zero_offset (oper))
01666         return (2);
01667       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 3) || register_inc (oper, 3))
01668         return (1);
01669       else
01670         return (2);
01671 
01672     default:
01673       return (1);
01674     }
01675 }
01676 
01677 int
01678 M_is_stack_operand_x86 (L_Operand * operand)
01679 {
01680   if (L_is_macro (operand) &&
01681       (operand->value.mac == LX86_MAC_ESP ||
01682        operand->value.mac == L_MAC_IP ||
01683        operand->value.mac == L_MAC_OP || operand->value.mac == L_MAC_LV))
01684     return (1);
01685 
01686   return (0);
01687 }
01688 
01689 int
01690 M_is_unsafe_macro_x86 (L_Operand * operand)
01691 {
01692   if ((L_is_macro (operand)) && (operand->value.mac == L_MAC_P1))
01693     return (1);
01694 
01695   if ((L_is_macro (operand)) && (operand->value.mac == L_MAC_P0))
01696     return (1);
01697 
01698   return (0);
01699 }
01700 
01701 
01702 int
01703 M_operand_type_x86 (L_Operand * operand)
01704 {
01705 /* fprintf(stderr,"$here\n");*/
01706   /* If NULL operand pointer, then return MDES_OPERAND_NULL */
01707   if (operand == NULL)
01708     return (MDES_OPERAND_NULL);
01709 
01710   switch (L_operand_case_type (operand))
01711     {
01712     case L_OPERAND_INT:
01713 /* fprintf(stderr,"$lit\n"); */
01714       return (MDES_OPERAND_Lit);
01715 
01716     case L_OPERAND_MACRO:
01717       if (operand->value.mac == LX86_MAC_FPSTACK)
01718         {
01719           return (MDES_OPERAND_fstk);
01720         }
01721       else if (operand->value.mac == LX86_MAC_STACK)
01722         {
01723           return (MDES_OPERAND_istk);
01724         }
01725       else if (operand->value.mac == LX86_MAC_FLAGS)
01726         {
01727 /* fprintf(stderr,"$flag\n"); */
01728           return (MDES_OPERAND_flag);
01729         }
01730       /* no break on purpose */
01731 
01732     case L_OPERAND_REGISTER:
01733 /*          if (L_is_ctype_flt(operand)) {
01734                 return(MDES_OPERAND_f);
01735             } else if (L_is_ctype_dbl(operand)) {
01736                 return(MDES_OPERAND_f2);
01737             } else
01738 */
01739       return (MDES_OPERAND_REG);
01740 
01741 
01742     case L_OPERAND_CB:
01743     case L_OPERAND_LABEL:
01744     case L_OPERAND_FLOAT:
01745     case L_OPERAND_DOUBLE:
01746     case L_OPERAND_STRING:
01747       return (MDES_OPERAND_Label);
01748 
01749     default:
01750       M_assert (0, "M_operand_type_x86: Unknown type");
01751     }
01752   return (0);
01753 }
01754 
01755 int
01756 M_conflicting_operands_x86 (L_Operand * operand, L_Operand ** conflict_array,
01757                             int len, int prepass)
01758 {
01759   if (L_is_ctype_dbl (operand))
01760     {
01761       /* Set up conflicting double register */
01762       conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01763 
01764       /* Set up conflicting float register */
01765       conflict_array[1] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01766       conflict_array[1]->ctype = L_CTYPE_FLOAT;
01767 
01768       conflict_array[2] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01769       conflict_array[2]->ctype = L_CTYPE_FLOAT;
01770       conflict_array[2]->value.r = operand->value.r + 1;
01771       return (3);
01772     }
01773   else if (L_is_ctype_flt (operand))
01774     {
01775       /* Set up conflicting double register */
01776       conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01777       conflict_array[0]->ctype = L_CTYPE_DOUBLE;
01778       if (operand->value.r % 2)
01779         conflict_array[0]->value.r = operand->value.r - 1;
01780       else
01781         conflict_array[0]->value.r = operand->value.r;
01782 
01783       /* Set up conflicting float register */
01784       conflict_array[1] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01785       return (2);
01786     }
01787   else
01788     {
01789       conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01790       return (1);
01791     }
01792 }
01793 
01794 
01795 void
01796 M_get_memory_operands_x86 (int *first, int *number, int proc_opc)
01797 {
01798   switch (proc_opc)
01799     {
01800     case LX86op_EQ_FMEM:
01801     case LX86op_EQ_F2MEM:
01802     case LX86op_NE_FMEM:
01803     case LX86op_NE_F2MEM:
01804     case LX86op_GT_FMEM:
01805     case LX86op_GT_F2MEM:
01806     case LX86op_GE_FMEM:
01807     case LX86op_GE_F2MEM:
01808     case LX86op_LT_FMEM:
01809     case LX86op_LT_F2MEM:
01810     case LX86op_LE_FMEM:
01811     case LX86op_LE_F2MEM:
01812     case LX86op_ADD_FMEM:
01813     case LX86op_ADD_F2MEM:
01814     case LX86op_SUB_FMEM:
01815     case LX86op_SUB_F2MEM:
01816     case LX86op_SUBR_FMEM:
01817     case LX86op_SUBR_F2MEM:
01818     case LX86op_MUL_FMEM:
01819     case LX86op_MUL_F2MEM:
01820     case LX86op_DIV_FMEM:
01821     case LX86op_DIV_F2MEM:
01822     case LX86op_DIVR_FMEM:
01823     case LX86op_DIVR_F2MEM:
01824     case LX86op_FPUSH_I:
01825     case LX86op_FPOP_I:
01826 
01827       *first = 1;
01828       *number = 4;
01829       break;
01830 
01831     case LX86op_MOVXL:
01832     case LX86op_INT_LOAD:
01833     case LX86op_INT_STORE:
01834     case LX86op_FLOAT_LOAD:
01835     case LX86op_FLOAT_STORE:
01836 
01837     case LX86op_FLDCW:
01838     case LX86op_FSTCW:
01839     case LX86op_PUSH:
01840     case LX86op_POP:
01841 
01842     case LX86op_CISC_TO_REG:
01843     case LX86op_CISC_TO_REG_TEST:
01844     case LX86op_CISC_TO_REG_CMP:        /* BS */
01845     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM:
01846     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM_INC:
01847     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM_DEC:
01848     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM_NEGATE:
01849       *first = 1;
01850       *number = 4;
01851       break;
01852 
01853     case LX86op_CISC_BRANCH:
01854       *first = 0;
01855       *number = 4;
01856       break;
01857 
01858     default:
01859     case Lop_LD_I:
01860     case Lop_LD_C:
01861     case Lop_LD_UC:
01862     case Lop_LD_C2:
01863     case Lop_LD_UC2:
01864     case Lop_LD_F:
01865     case Lop_LD_F2:
01866     case Lop_ST_I:
01867     case Lop_ST_C:
01868     case Lop_ST_C2:
01869     case Lop_ST_F:
01870     case Lop_ST_F2:
01871       *first = 0;
01872       *number = 2;
01873     }
01874 }
01875 
01876 int
01877 M_memory_access_size_x86 (L_Oper * op)
01878 {
01879 
01880   switch (op->proc_opc)
01881     {
01882       /* Proc_opc for sign extended loads of byte or word -DML */
01883     case LX86op_MOVXL:
01884       if ((op->opc == Lop_LD_UC2) || (op->opc == Lop_LD_C2))
01885         return (M_type_size (M_TYPE_SHORT) / M_SIZE_CHAR);
01886       else if ((op->opc == Lop_LD_UC) || (op->opc == Lop_LD_C))
01887         return 1;
01888       else
01889         I_punt
01890           ("M_memory_access_size_x86 (op %i): "
01891            "unexpected opc %i for Lop_MOVXL\n",
01892            op->id, op->opc);
01893 
01894 
01895     case LX86op_FPUSH_I:
01896     case LX86op_FPOP_I:
01897     case LX86op_PUSH:
01898     case LX86op_INT_LOAD:
01899     case LX86op_INT_STORE:
01900     case LX86op_CISC_TO_REG:
01901     case LX86op_CISC_TO_REG_TEST:
01902     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM:
01903     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM_INC:
01904     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM_DEC:
01905     case LX86op_CISC_TO_REG_CMP:
01906     case LX86op_CISC_BRANCH:
01907     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM_NEGATE:
01908 
01909 /*
01910         if (attr=L_find_attr(oper->attr, "short_opr") != NULL))
01911             if (attr->field[0]->value.i == 1)
01912                 return (M_SIZE_CHAR)
01913         else    
01914 */
01915       return (M_type_size (M_TYPE_INT) / M_SIZE_CHAR);
01916 
01917     case LX86op_EQ_FMEM:
01918     case LX86op_NE_FMEM:
01919     case LX86op_GT_FMEM:
01920     case LX86op_GE_FMEM:
01921     case LX86op_LT_FMEM:
01922     case LX86op_LE_FMEM:
01923     case LX86op_ADD_FMEM:
01924     case LX86op_SUB_FMEM:
01925     case LX86op_SUBR_FMEM:
01926     case LX86op_MUL_FMEM:
01927     case LX86op_DIV_FMEM:
01928     case LX86op_DIVR_FMEM:
01929     case LX86op_FSTCW:
01930     case LX86op_FLDCW:
01931       return (M_type_size (M_TYPE_FLOAT) / M_SIZE_CHAR);
01932 
01933     case LX86op_EQ_F2MEM:
01934     case LX86op_NE_F2MEM:
01935     case LX86op_GT_F2MEM:
01936     case LX86op_GE_F2MEM:
01937     case LX86op_LT_F2MEM:
01938     case LX86op_LE_F2MEM:
01939     case LX86op_ADD_F2MEM:
01940     case LX86op_SUB_F2MEM:
01941     case LX86op_SUBR_F2MEM:
01942     case LX86op_MUL_F2MEM:
01943     case LX86op_DIV_F2MEM:
01944     case LX86op_DIVR_F2MEM:
01945       return (M_type_size (M_TYPE_DOUBLE) / M_SIZE_CHAR);
01946 
01947     case LX86op_FLOAT_LOAD:
01948     case LX86op_FLOAT_STORE:
01949       switch (op->opc)
01950         {
01951         case Lop_LD_F:
01952         case Lop_ST_F:
01953           return (M_type_size (M_TYPE_FLOAT) / M_SIZE_CHAR);
01954         case Lop_LD_F2:
01955         case Lop_ST_F2:
01956           return (M_type_size (M_TYPE_DOUBLE) / M_SIZE_CHAR);
01957         default:
01958           M_assert (0, "M_memory_access_size_x86: illegal float ld/st");
01959         }
01960 
01961 
01962     default:
01963       M_assert (0, "M_memory_access_size_x86: illegal proc_opc");
01964       return (0);
01965     }
01966 }
01967 
01968 
01969 int
01970 M_get_data_type_x86 (L_Oper * op)
01971 {
01972 
01973   switch (op->proc_opc)
01974     {
01975 
01976       /* Proc_opc for sign extended loads of byte or word -DML */
01977     case LX86op_MOVXL:
01978       if ((op->opc == Lop_LD_UC2) || (op->opc == Lop_LD_C2))
01979         return (L_MEMORY_ACCESS_CHAR2);
01980       else if ((op->opc == Lop_LD_UC) || (op->opc == Lop_LD_C))
01981         return (L_MEMORY_ACCESS_CHAR);
01982       else
01983         I_punt
01984           ("M_get_data_type_x86 (op %i): unexpected opc %i for Lop_MOVXL\n",
01985            op->id, op->opc);
01986 
01987     case LX86op_FPUSH_I:
01988     case LX86op_FPOP_I:
01989     case LX86op_PUSH:
01990 /* added by wfd  */
01991     case LX86op_INT_LOAD:
01992     case LX86op_INT_STORE:
01993     case LX86op_CISC_TO_REG:
01994     case LX86op_CISC_TO_REG_TEST:
01995     case LX86op_CISC_BRANCH:
01996     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM:
01997     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM_INC:
01998     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM_DEC:
01999     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM_NEGATE:
02000     case LX86op_CISC_TO_REG_CMP:
02001 /*3-14-95*/
02002       return (L_MEMORY_ACCESS_INT);
02003 
02004     case LX86op_EQ_FMEM:
02005     case LX86op_NE_FMEM:
02006     case LX86op_GT_FMEM:
02007     case LX86op_GE_FMEM:
02008     case LX86op_LT_FMEM:
02009     case LX86op_LE_FMEM:
02010     case LX86op_ADD_FMEM:
02011     case LX86op_SUB_FMEM:
02012     case LX86op_SUBR_FMEM:
02013     case LX86op_MUL_FMEM:
02014     case LX86op_DIV_FMEM:
02015     case LX86op_DIVR_FMEM:
02016     case LX86op_FSTCW:
02017     case LX86op_FLDCW:
02018 /* added by wfd  */
02019     case LX86op_FLOAT_LOAD:
02020     case LX86op_FLOAT_STORE:
02021 /*3-14-95*/
02022       return (L_MEMORY_ACCESS_FLOAT);
02023 
02024     case LX86op_EQ_F2MEM:
02025     case LX86op_NE_F2MEM:
02026     case LX86op_GT_F2MEM:
02027     case LX86op_GE_F2MEM:
02028     case LX86op_LT_F2MEM:
02029     case LX86op_LE_F2MEM:
02030     case LX86op_ADD_F2MEM:
02031     case LX86op_SUB_F2MEM:
02032     case LX86op_SUBR_F2MEM:
02033     case LX86op_MUL_F2MEM:
02034     case LX86op_DIV_F2MEM:
02035     case LX86op_DIVR_F2MEM:
02036       return (L_MEMORY_ACCESS_DOUBLE);
02037 
02038     default:
02039       M_assert (0, "M_get_data_types_x86: unexpected proc_opc");
02040     }
02041 
02042   return (L_CTYPE_INT);
02043 }
02044 
02045 int
02046 M_num_registers_x86 (int ctype)
02047 {
02048   switch (ctype)
02049     {
02050     case L_CTYPE_INT:
02051       return (7);
02052     case L_CTYPE_FLOAT:
02053     case L_CTYPE_DOUBLE:
02054       return (10000);           /* cheat infinite */
02055     default:
02056       return (0);
02057     }
02058 }
02059 
02060 int
02061 M_is_implicit_memory_op_x86 (L_Oper * oper)
02062 /*
02063  * Returns 0 if the operation does not implicitly generates
02064  * a memory address.  Otherwise, the return value indicates
02065  * the location of the operands which are used to generate the
02066  * address: 
02067         (1) "Standard" 5-operand load/store format, with the
02068                 4 operands for the address in src1, src2, src3, and src4.
02069                 Used for CISC operations.
02070 
02071         (2) Implicit stack reference.  Used for JSR / RET instructions.
02072 
02073         (3) Floating point memory operation - memory operands in src1 and src2.
02074  */
02075 {
02076   /* only implicit if not ld/st */
02077   if (L_general_load_opcode (oper) || L_general_store_opcode (oper))
02078     return (0);
02079 
02080   /* 
02081    * Handle instructions which always generate memory addresses 
02082    * but aren't loads or stores  - currently, jsr's and rets
02083    * push or pop a memory operand to / from the stack. 
02084    */
02085   switch (oper->opc)
02086     {
02087     case Lop_JSR:
02088     case Lop_JSR_FS:
02089     case Lop_RTS:
02090     case Lop_RTS_FS:
02091       return 2;
02092     };
02093 
02094   /* 
02095    * Look at proc_opc to identify instructions which
02096    *  generate addresses.  This includes CISC operations
02097    *  and "special" cases like the floating pt operations, 
02098    *  POP instructions, etc. 
02099    */
02100   switch (oper->proc_opc)
02101     {
02102     case LX86op_CISC_TO_REG:
02103     case LX86op_CISC_TO_REG_TEST:
02104     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM:
02105     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM_INC:
02106     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM_DEC:
02107     case LX86op_CISC_TO_REG_CMP:
02108     case LX86op_CISC_TO_MEM_NEGATE:
02109 
02110     case LX86op_POP:
02111       /* Pops used to be annotated by moves - so if the pop is
02112          not an explicit LOAD / STORE instruction, signal that
02113          it generates an implicit memory address */
02114       return 1;
02115 
02116     case LX86op_EQ_FMEM:
02117     case LX86op_EQ_F2MEM:
02118     case LX86op_NE_FMEM:
02119     case LX86op_NE_F2MEM:
02120     case LX86op_GT_FMEM:
02121     case LX86op_GT_F2MEM:
02122     case LX86op_GE_FMEM:
02123     case LX86op_GE_F2MEM:
02124     case LX86op_LT_FMEM:
02125     case LX86op_LT_F2MEM:
02126     case LX86op_LE_FMEM:
02127     case LX86op_LE_F2MEM:
02128 
02129     case LX86op_ADD_FMEM:
02130     case LX86op_ADD_F2MEM:
02131     case LX86op_SUB_FMEM:
02132     case LX86op_SUB_F2MEM:
02133     case LX86op_SUBR_FMEM:
02134     case LX86op_SUBR_F2MEM:
02135     case LX86op_MUL_FMEM:
02136     case LX86op_MUL_F2MEM:
02137     case LX86op_DIV_FMEM:
02138     case LX86op_DIVR_FMEM:
02139     case LX86op_DIV_F2MEM:
02140     case LX86op_DIVR_F2MEM:
02141       return 1;
02142 
02143     };
02144 
02145 
02146   return 0;
02147 }
